attributes.action: Hold a survey to see how many voted for Brexit in protest but didn't want it.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a Barbadian writer in exile. I came to England on my wife's insistence, for the sake of our children. Our marriage is over. The only thing keeping me here is our children.

Were it not for our children I would not have left Barbados, even though my life was at risk there, as it is in England, because of incestuous Barbadian-British allegiances.

I am in England because I will not surrender my duty of care for my children to my wife - far less to politicians!

Do you trust politicians?
attributes.background:
Shortly after the EU referendum a retired medical professional told me  he voted for Brexit in protest and did not expect to win.

This grandfather was distressed because he felt he had surrendered younger people to a difficult future that he won't have to face himself.

How many feel the same?
